page.title: 09FARMING : SWANSEA WEST
page.content: Farming in our area is mainly concentrated along Cockett valley. The valley runs approx. East to West and so only the Northern farms have a favourable aspect. Cefn Coed-bach Farm is of 8 Ha with 4 Ha being improved grassland. This is a dairy farm with a small herd of 15 milking cows,a mixture of Freisians and Jerseys, using a milking machine and refridgerated storage. As a result of milk quotas, production has been reduced and now there is some cattle fattening instead.Elsewhere,poultry, sheep and horses are kept and some fields with a sunnier aspect are sown, often with oil-seed rape. Soils are generally loamy,drained by virtue of the slope. The farms are a mixture of tenanted and owner-occupied.
